laboratory_examinations.findings: Elevated CSF protein content of 0.85 g/L, CSF glucose and cell counts were normal.
Showed asymmetric polymorphic delta waves involving the right hemisphere.
Diffuse and smooth postcontrast enhancement of the leptomeninges; absent evidence of blood product within the leptomeninges or parenchyma.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: MRI was unchanged from 1 year previous.

laboratory_examinations.findings: No cardiac dysfunction was found, although endomyocardial biopsy showed amyloid deposits.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Transthyretin gene sequencing and SSCP analyses
laboratory_examinations.findings: SSCP analysis of exon 3 showed an abnormal migration pattern; direct sequencing revealed heterozygosity for the ATTR Tyr69His mutation.
MRI was performed without contrast and results were normal.
Postcontrast T1-weighted imaging demonstrated smooth leptomeningeal enhancement.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Subtler than in the index patient.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Showed smooth and diffuse enhancement of the leptomeninges; no intraparenchymal lesions.
